00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the literal Number instructions.
00017 
00018 #include <ieee754.hpp>
00019 #include <machine.hpp>
00020 #include <instructions.hpp>
00021 
00022 namespace Instructions {
00023     
00024     /// \name Literals
00025     /// \{
00026     
00027 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != MIT_ONLY
00028     /// Literal Number.
00029     /**
00030      * \param Int The value.
00031      * \return The value as a Number.
00032      */
00033     void LIT(Machine & machine){
00034         machine.stack.push(machine.nextInt());
00035     }
00036 #endif
00037     
00038 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != NO_MIT
00039     /// Literal Number.
00040     /**
00041      * \param Int8 The value.
00042      * \return The value as a Number.
00043      * 
00044      * \deprecated_mitproto{LIT}
00045      */
00046     void LIT8(Machine & machine){
00047         machine.stack.push(machine.nextInt8());
00048     }
00049     
00050     /// Literal Number.
00051     /**
00052      * \param Int16 The value.
00053      * \return The value as a Number.
00054      * 
00055      * \deprecated_mitproto{LIT}
00056      */
00057     void LIT16(Machine & machine){
00058         machine.stack.push(machine.nextInt16());
00059     }
00060 #endif
00061     
00062     /// Literal Number.
00063     /**
00064      * \tparam value The value.
00065      * \return The value as a Number.
00066      */
00067     template<int value>
00068     void LIT_N(Machine & machine){
00069         machine.stack.push(value);
00070     }
00071     
00072     /// Literal Number.
00073     /**
00074      * \param IEEE754binary32 The value.
00075      * \return The value as a Number.
00076      */
00077     void LIT_FLO(Machine & machine){
00078         Int8 float_data[4];
00079         float_data[0] = machine.nextInt8();
00080         float_data[1] = machine.nextInt8();
00081         float_data[2] = machine.nextInt8();
00082         float_data[3] = machine.nextInt8();
00083         machine.stack.push(Number(IEEE754binary32(float_data)));
00084     }
00085     
00086     /// Positive infinity.
00087     /**
00088      * \return \m{+\infty}
00089      */
00090     void INF(Machine & machine){
00091         machine.stack.push(Number_infinity);
00092     }
00093     
00094 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != MIT_ONLY
00095     /// Negative infinity.
00096     /**
00097      * \return \m{-\infty}
00098      */
00099     void NEG_INF(Machine & machine){
00100         machine.stack.push(-Number_infinity);
00101     }
00102 #endif
00103     
00104 }
